text: Meyer Dwass (April 9, 1923 – July 15, 1996) was an American mathematical statistician known for his contributions to applied probability. Dwass was a professor of statistics at Northwestern University.http://findingaids.library.northwestern.edu/catalog/inu-ead-nua- archon-548 Born in New Haven, Connecticut, Dwass attended George Washington University, earning a bachelor's degree in 1948. Under supervision of Wassilij Höffding, he earned a Ph.D. from University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill in 1952. == References == == External links == * Category:1923 births Category:1996 deaths Category:American statisticians Category:George Washington University alumni Category:University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill alumni Category:Northwestern University faculty Category:Scientists from New Haven, Connecticut
title: Meyer Dwass
